caption: It's a small and pretty museum to visit when you're near the Jardin du Luxembourg. The art in this museum is really precious and beautiful and unique from Zadkine. Book your tickets in advance on weekends because it's a small museum and can get a bit crowded.
A beautiful exhibition of an extremely talented artist. Located in a quiet area of Paris with some of the sculptures set in the garden.

Tucked away in what I would describe as my dream house in Paris you will find the musée Zadkine. It offers thought provoking exhibitions and an interesting permanent collection - all displayed in a charming residential setting. I visited with a 4 year old (who was very welcome!) and we both appreciated the works and the building.  (Would also recommend a nice stroll in the Jardin du Luxembourg after!)
Little hidden gem. Small but the three areas of display are worth the trip to see these 2 artists of distinction.

As a Belarusian myself, I went to the museum to pay respect to my fellow countryman Ossip Zadkin. Although the ticket price is definitely too much (the museum is basically Zadkin's old house where he used to work and where the pieces donated by his widow are left), it was nice to see what a true genius he was.
Lovely museum with a beautiful garden. It’s so calm and the perfect place to relax.
A small museum, but definitely worth it. very near the Luxembourg gardens. Also, free entrance.
When we arrived it was free to enter, there are some nice pieces in the garden, and afterwards you can observe some others inside.
Very nice little museum of the famous scupltor. Beautiful little inner garden and the atelier is still intact. Pay a visit when you're in Paris. At the south edge of Jardin the Luxembourg
Cute small museum. Free entrance and there is a lady who read for the children if they come. Lovely!
Very nice small museum in the atelier of Zadkine with numerous copies of his famous statues
Very nice museum and short walk from the southwest corner of Luxembourg garden.
Nice open Mosque, friendly people and beautiful gardens.

A lovely, free museum of zadkine sculptor works with a beautiful picket garden! The former workshop of the artist turned into a little museum that is worth a visit to see his work, enjoy the garden and all for free!!! A must stop if the area. It can be visited in about 15 to 45 minutes.
Hidden gem, not flashy, just the real thing. With nice selection of sculptures and sketches.
Interesting small museum hidden in the backyard near Jardin de Luxembourg
Very nice small museum, free
This small house and atelier is so charming and the work so varied and beautiful. Amazing sculptures in many different materials. Modern, abstract, very innovative.

The small museum is definitely worth a visit if you are coming to Paris. A beautiful and peaceful place that teaches you about an artist who is definitly not as known as he dervses. Admission free also. Can't recommend enough!
Small but free. The actual place he did his work. Very modern.

This small museum is worth while visiting. The art work is interesting (only sculptures) but what was really nice was the museums location and the fact that the artist himself had lived and worked in this small house and studio. Unfortunately, however, there is not very much evidence of Zadkines' everyday life and work in the museum (like a kitchen or his studio).
Intimate and warm. The sculptures in his studio and the small garden make this a museum you can take your time in and still be done in under 3 hours. Highly recommend!

Saw this museum advertised in the Metro and around town. Disappointed in the size, however the pieces, especially the sculptures were presented well.  Since we don't read French, we were done in 30 minutes.
Small and charming.
Free entrance

Small, hidden museum. It's very brief, but it was free for me. It's great if you have some time to visit a museum, but don't want to put the effort into thinking to hard and trying to register too many informations at once, while still getting to know an interesting artist that is not too well known. The spaces are quite nice

The Musée Zadkine is a museum dedicated to the work of Russian sculptor Ossip Zadkine (1890–1967). It is located near the Jardin du Luxembourg in the 6th arrondissement at 100 bis, rue d'Assas, Paris, France, and open daily except Monday; an admission fee is only charged during exhibitions. The museum also contains a fine garden, with no charge for entry. The nearest métro and RER stations are Port-Royal and Vavin.
A beautiful little gem! It’s tiny yet packed with good work. So glad I found it!
Found the sculpture of the Van Gogh brothers in an obscure spot in the garden on the way out...unexpectedly very poignant.

Hidden in the artists former studio near the Jardin Luxembourg- you’ll see a sign on the street - go right into the drive even though it looks like someone’s home!  Lovely space, small intimate setting showing the history of his work (a contemporary of Chagall and Modigliani) from early to late. Later works in a charming garden. Was a treat to be in the space he actually used to create.  Get the audio - for me he was not well known so I learned more about him from the tape. Entry is free, tape was €5 ... and they accept donations.
A beautiful collection of unique sculptures by the modernist Zadkine set within his former studio and around a lovely, tranquil courtyard. Well worth visiting and often free entry.
Quick! Go see the Chana Orloff exhibition before it closes!! Amazing!
Tucked away, this small studio museum has outdoor sculptures and mounts temporary exhibitions. A little oasis of calm in the city.
A small museum with a nice gardin
Lovely place with an interesting exhibition. You'll need 30-45 min to see everything. Worth visiting :)
A beautiful museum dituated in the house of the artist! Beautiful small garden to visit...
Great museum atelier. Very intimate and free of charge as well. Beautiful garden.
Not to be missed! Charming museum and intimate atmosphere.
